text: let's now see solve problem number nine
in subnetting let's dive into the
question now the question is the address
of a class b host is to be split into
subnets with a 6-bit subnet number
what is the maximum number of subnets
and the maximum number of hosts in each
subnet and this question was asked in
gate computer science in the year 2007
and the options are also given option is
62 subnets and 2 lakh 62 142 hosts
option b 64 subnets and 2 lakh 62 142
hosts option c 62 subnets and 1022 hosts
and option d64 subnets and 1024 hosts
before we dive into the solution part we
should understand what is the default
subnet mask before submitting was done
the default subnet mask was class b and
this class b is split into subnets with
a 6 bit subnet number please make a note
of this it is a 6 bit subnet number
let's solve this now we know as usual
will be starting with the subnet mask
which is given in the question so the
initial subnet mask or the default

because it's a class b subnet mask and
this class b subnet mask only is
subnetted with a 6 bit subnet number and
this 6 bit subnet number means the
number of bits that are used for the
network portion so the number of bits
that are used for the network portion is
six so we are going to reserve six ones
in the network portion please note here
this is subnetting based on network
requirement not based on host
requirement so obviously we are going to
reserve six ones in the third octet
because it's a class b subnet mask the

progress into the solution
so six bits are used for the subnetting

obviously six bits are used for the

because in the question it is mentioned

2 power 6 networks are possible right
because we are going to reserve 6 once
here so the new subnet mask will be
why because six bits are one means it's

out of 16 bits 6 bits are for the

portion so 2 power 6 which is equal to

is 1024 hosts possible so we are clear
that 2 power 6 which is equal to 64

also we are going to reduce two from it

from it why because
the first address and the last address
are not used so this is 1024 minus 2 is
1022. we are saying this for the first
time as per rfc 950 specification we
need to reduce 2 from the number of

possible but based on the question you
